Bottlenecks#

  • inception

Inception#

class liedet.models.necks.inception.Inception(in_channels: int, num_levels: int, conv_cfg: dict[str, Any] | None = None, norm_cfg: dict[str, Any] | None = None, dcn_cfg: dict[str, Any] | None = None, share: bool = False, **kwargs)[source]#

Bases: torch.nn.modules.module.Module

Inception module

This architecture is used on the coarsest grids to promote high dimensional representations.

See also: Inception Module, Rethinking the Inception Architecture for Computer Vision.

__init__(in_channels: int, num_levels: int, conv_cfg: dict[str, Any] | None = None, norm_cfg: dict[str, Any] | None = None, dcn_cfg: dict[str, Any] | None = None, share: bool = False, **kwargs)[source]#
Parameters

  • in_channels (int) – number of input channels.

  • num_levels (int) – number of feature levels.

  • conv_cfg (dict[str, Any] | None, optional) – dictionary with parameters of convolutional layers. Defaults to None.

  • norm_cfg (dict[str, Any] | None, optional) – dictionary with parameters of normalization layer. Defaults to None.

  • dcn_cfg (dict[str, Any] | None, optional) – dictionary with parameters for deformable convolutional layers. Defaults to None.

  • share (bool, optional) – boolean flag to share convolutions over levels of features. Defaults to False.

init_weights() → None[source]#

Weights initialization.

forward(input: tuple[torch.Tensor, ...]) → tuple[torch.Tensor, ...][source]#

Forwards features of each feature levels to convolutional blocks.

Parameters

input (tuple[Tensor, ...]) – input tuple of level features.

Returns

output tuple of level features after inception.

Return type

tuple[Tensor, …]
